intro: Piper aduncum var. laevilimbum, commonly known as the roughleaf pepper plant, is a tropical species native to Central and South America. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its rough, warty leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces berries that turn from green to red as they mature, containing elliptical seeds. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in warm climates for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
